descMeta.title: Age of the Ocean Floor
descMeta.description: "The color image representing crustal ages was created from a digital age grid of the ocean floor with a grid node interval of 0.1 degrees using a self-consistent set of global isochrons and associated plate reconstruction poles. ..."

descMeta.title: Greetings from Washington County, Maryland, circa 1960-1990
descMeta.description: Greetings from Washington County, Maryland, circa 1960-1990. Caption reads: "Self Guided Tour Map of Washington County, Maryland. No. 1 -- Take (green) I-70 West to Indian Springs turnoff. Follow Fort Frederick State Park signs. Nos. 2-3 --Take (red) U.S. No. 11 South to City Park Circle and turn right to Hager House, Washington County Museum and City Park. No. 4 -- Then continue on U.S. No 11 South to Williamsport and the C&O Canal which follows the Potomac River from Cumberland to near Washington, D.C. 185 miles -- Antietam National Battle Field. Take (blue) State Rt. 65 South to Sharpsburg. No. 5 -- Washington Monument State Park take (blue) Rt. ALT U.S. 40 East to top of S. Mountain, turn left. Follow signs to Park. Nos. 6-7 -- Come back ALT U.S. 40 West from top of S. Mountain to State St. 67. Turn left to Gathland State Park and War Correspondents Memorial. To get to Harpers Ferry National Monument come back to Md. State Rt. 67, turn left to U.S. 340 West, then cross Potomac River and follow signs to Harpers ferry and John Browns Fort. Maryland, West Virginia and Virginia can be seen from here. No.8 -- Greenbrier State Park, take (red) U.S. 40 East to near top of S. Mountain, turn right -- Fine fishing, boating and swimming. Fort Ritchie: Take State Rt. 64 North -- Renfrew Museum. Take State Rt. 64 North to Waynesboro, Pennsylvania, turn right on Pa.16 to east end town. Museum is on your right."
descMeta.rights: Collection may be protected under Title 17 of the U.S. Copyright Law. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the University of Maryland Libraries at http://www.lib.umd.edu/NTL/queries.html.
unknown

descMeta.title: Irish Resources in the Humanities
descMeta.description: Irish Resources in the Humanities was developed in 1999 at University College Dublin by Dr. Susan Schreibman as a Gateway to sites on the World Wide Web that contain substantial content in the various disciplines of the humanities in the area of Irish Studies. As a rule, commercial sites are not linked.

descMeta.title: GIS Data Repository, University of Maryland Libraries
descMeta.description: The University of Maryland’s GIS Data Repository was created in fall 2010 in an effort to provide easier access to some of the geospatial data in the University of Maryland Libraries' collection that is on CDs. By bringing together all of our geospatial data or records about it, the entire collection will be much easier to search comprehensively. Here you can search for downloadable data layers, as well as get a sense of some of the spatial data in our library collection.

The University of Maryland’s GIS Data Repository provides easier access to some of the geospatial data in the University of Maryland Libraries' collection that is on CDs. Here you can search for downloadable data layers, as well as get a sense of some of the spatial data in our library collection.

descMeta.title: A Century of Progress Exposition Official Book of Views
descMeta.description: cover showing birds-eye view

This panoramic aerial view on the front cover of Official Book of Views of the Century of Progress Exposition reflects the colorful decorative scheme of that fair. The 1893 exhibition in Chicago had adopted the architectural theme of the "White City," in which the 14 major exhibit halls conformed to a uniformly white appearance. Under the direction of Joseph Urban, the 1933 exhibition contrasted the earlier fair with its "Rainbow City" scheme, suggested by the vibrant colors used to illustrate the fair in this viewbook.
